contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|wormwood}} '''Wormwood''' may refer to: ==Plants== * Various plants of the genus ''[[Artemisia (plant)|Artemisia]]'' particularly ** ''[[Artemisia absinthium]]'' (grande wormwood or absinthe wormwood) ** ''[[Artemisia annua]]'' (sweet wormwood or annual wormwood) ** ''[[Artemisia herba-alba]]'' (white wormwood), the wormwood of the Bible ** ''[[Artemisia pontica]]'' (Roman wormwood) ** ''[[Artemisia vulgaris]]'' (common wormwood) Other plants:- * ''[[Ambrosia artemisiifolia]]'' (Roman wormwood) * ''[[Senna artemisioides]]'' (wormwood senna) ==Comics== *[[Miss Wormwood]], a minor character in ''Calvin and Hobbes'' *''[[Wormwood: Gentleman Corpse]]'', a comic book series by Ben Templesmith *''[[Chronicles of Wormwood]]'', a comic book miniseries by Garth Ennis from Avatar Press ==Literature== * [[Wormwood (star)]], in the Book of Revelation, a star that falls upon Earth and poisons a third part of the waters *[[Wormwood (magazine)|''Wormwood'' (magazine)]], a magazine of literature and literary criticism *[[Wormwood (book)|''Wormwood'' (book)]], a book of short horror stories by Poppy Z. Brite *''[[Wormwood: A Drama of Paris]]'', a 1890 novel by Marie Corelli *[[Wormwood (G. P. Taylor)|''Wormwood'' (G. P. Taylor)]], a 2004 fantasy novel by Graham Taylor *Wormwood, a character in C. S. Lewis's ''[[The Screwtape Letters]]'' *[[List of The Sarah Jane Adventures minor characters#W|Mrs Wormwood]], a character in the pilot episode of ''The Sarah Jane Adventures: "Invasion of the Bane"'', who reappeared in ''Enemy of the Bane'' *[[Mr. Wormwood]], a fictional character in the British book ''Matilda'', by Roald Dahl, and lead character in the film based on the book *[[Wormwood Review]], a literary magazine published from 1959 to 1999 *Wormwood Deathship described in the [[Abarat]] books by [[Clive Barker ]] ==Music== *[[Wormwood (Bader Nana album)|''Wormwood'' (Bader Nana album)]], 2011 *[[Wormwood (Marduk album)|''Wormwood'' (Marduk album)]], 2009 *[[Wormwood (moe. album)|''Wormwood'' (moe. album)]], 2003 *''[[Wormwood: Curious Stories from the Bible]]'', a 1998 album by The Residents *[[Wormwood (The Acacia Strain album)|''Wormwood'' (The Acacia Strain album)]], 2010 *"Wormwood", a song by [[Callisto (band)|Callisto]] *"Wormwood", a song by [[Tristania (band)|Tristania]] *"Wormwood", a song by [[Snowman (band)|Snowman]] *"Wormwood", a song by [[Michale Graves]] *"Wormwood", a song by [[Fozzy (band)| Fozzy]] *''[[Wormwood Live]]'', a 1999 live album by the Residents *"Wormwood", a song by [[Campaign (band)| Campaign]] *"Wormwood", a song by [[Close Your Eyes (band)| Close Your Eyes]] ==Places== *[[HM Prison Wormwood Scrubs]], a prison in West London *[[Wormwood Scrubs]], an open space in the Hammersmith area of West London *[[Wormwood Street]] in the City of London == Other references == *[[Wormwood (computer virus)]], a proof of concept computer virus infecting FreeBSD systems, perhaps the first published virus for this OS *[[Wormwood (TV series)|''Wormwood'' (TV series)]], a Canadian and Australian children's television program {{disambiguation}}
